question: 米国
sourceMnemonic: America is the <kanji>country</kanji> of <kanji>rice</kanji>. I guess this is from all those rolling plains and such we have. Another way to say America in Japanese is <ja>アメリカ</ja>, but this is another more formal (and older) way. "Rice Country" aka <vocabulary>United States Of America</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>United States</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>America</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>USA</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
